https://prez.dev/description.@value: The primary purpose for which a borehole was drilled or any secondary purpose that the borehole may acquire during its lifecycle. The vocabulary focuses on drilling purposes within the resources industry, with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. Some terms covered by jurisdictional legislation are highlighted in the provenance field. Variations in terminology within definitions (i.e. usage of borehole, well and wellbore) stem from usage in different sectors of the resources industry, but for the purpose of this vocabulary are considered to be equivalent. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A borehole drilled to identify the physical and geochemical properties of materials and whether they have the potential to cause environmental harm and/or contribute to, or detract from, the success of rehabilitation and closure. This drilling focuses on identification of fibrous materials, radioactive materials, materials capable of generating acid and/or metalliferous drainage (including neutral drainage and saline drainage), and dispersive and/or erosive material.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from DEMIRS, Mining Proposal Guidance v 4.0, January 2023. Section 8.3 Materials Characterisation (https://dmp.wa.gov.au/documents/Environment/REC-EC-115D.pdf).

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A borehole drilled to identify the physical and geochemical properties of materials and whether they have the potential to cause environmental harm and/or contribute to, or detract from, the success of rehabilitation and closure. This drilling focuses on identification of fibrous materials, radioactive materials, materials capable of generating acid and/or metalliferous drainage (including neutral drainage and saline drainage), and dispersive and/or erosive material.
